logic

Class Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • logic.Handler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Handler
extends java.lang.Thread
    Handles a client communications with the server through sockets. The Handler can register or unregister a client, add, delete, or check the availability of particular files in the database.
    See Also:
    Client, Server

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      • isAvailable

        private void isAvailable(java.lang.String fileName,
               java.lang.String remoteClientName)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if a particular file is available for downloading (i.e. present in the database). If so, a message is sent to the requesting client.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the requested file
        remoteClientName - The name of the remote client the client whishes to download the file from
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • fileSearch

        private void fileSearch(java.lang.String[] keywords,
              java.lang.String fileType,
              java.lang.String clientName)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Search the database for files matching with the keywords, file type and client name (not implemented yet). One done, the reply is built and sent to the requesting client.
        Parameters:
        keywords - The keywords the client is searching for
        fileType - The type the files have to be
        clientName - The client the files have to belong
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
